page.title: 05Seventy Years in Drayton(4)
page.content: After the walk they have a service in the church and then, tea in the hall. The hall used to be our school, but it was closed and was bought by the village and it is now used as a Village Hall. Wartime was quiet here. We were lucky we only lost one of the village men who went to fight. We had evacuees in the school, with their teachers, and they were billeted in all the houses. We always get flooding in the low parts of the village when we get heavy rain. Once, when it was bad, we were cut off between us and Curry Rivel, East Street and Norh Street and the bottom of School Street, and it always floods between us and Muchelney. A few people get it in their houses. Midelney also gets cut off, down near the river.
